Review Text: The customer service here was amazing the server callum was especially great he microwaved the ketchup for me exactly to my specifications. Great time!
Stumbled upon this spoons and have to say, it was great food, quick service and a really nice atmosphere 👌
Always packed but can usually get a table and the food is a good price

Outstanding Wetherspoons....never had a bad meal here...Beer on point as always....staff all good!
Always busy...but can usually find a seat after a little wait.
Great breakfast nice coffee refills and nice service.

Very good weatherspoons pub staff were very good bar was very busy food was absolutely excellent best fish-and-chips I've had for a long long time it was 10/10 the fish-and-chips I wanted was a small one but it was not available So I went for the large fish-and-chips it was Massive Fresh I'm very nice all in all Happy days at £8.60 with a soft drink
Descent place a lot issues than in Manchester with odiots all good never had problems great staff also.
A proper local Weather spoons, all the expected ales and food but with a real feel of customers who live round the corner. Friendly bar staff, well run, clean tidy and welcoming.

Don't bother if you're not a regular (eg, banging on the shutters at opening time), you will be invisible! People who arrive at the bar several minutes after you will be served before you. Staff will take orders over your head rather than serve you. Prices aren't particularly cheap for Middleton . Place is tiered and needs a refurbishment urgently. Not a patch on the Spoons in Bury, Rochdale, or Manchester .

Staff aren't great , the old guy who runs it has a bad attitude, stinks and it's boring.  But the beers cheap so that makes up for it.  If your going for a decent drink and a bit of a crawl,  go to town , there's weatherspoons all over the gaf
Staff are a joke big lad in charge is ignorant every time it rains roof leaks and shut the bar once the regulars have been served avoid it like the plague
The food was terrible, which is a shame because the pub has a really nice atmosphere. The Fish was soaking in oil and my wife's steak was over 25% grissle and fat

Staff are too scared to deal with complaints, trying to pass the book instead of taking control. Got verbally abused by pissheads who were already told that they were not allowed any more beer. 10 seconds later got served. Might give this spoons a miss for a while. Didn't feel safe inside
Used to like the pub but recently the food and quality of the place has gone bad. I have started drinking in other pubs and wouldn't recommend this pub.

A complete lack of bar training- on a quite day with 3 people at the bar he still failed to recognise a Customer waiting- and kept serving new arrival / friends .
15 min later I gave up I did ask him on several occasions.
After a long day , I just wanted a drink on the way home.
👎👎👎

Very poor 'traditional' breakfast egg pretty much inedible suspect hash browns were reheated old leftovers from day before, bacon cold and positively anemic on the other hand sausage ok.
Also if one has the temerity to complain be prepared for a less than polite response

Sorry but took my wife in for a drink after a great day Christmas shopping, only to be met by drinkers sat openly and blatantly rolling cannibis spliffs in full view. We told the duty manager who apologised but did not deal with the culprits. We left!!!!.
Not a good experience. Ordered the gammon and it was undercooked. Returned it and it was still undercooked!! Glass of wine smelled and tasted of detergent.
If only the good beer wasn't coming soon and the staff served you instead of cleaning up the pots
Has anybody noticed when you order toast it comes out cold also served with melted butter placed on the top spreadable
Should be called Wacky Warehouse from now on because there are so many uncontrolled kids running wild every time I go in
Door staff are thugs, when you speak to management they don't seem to care
Dont use the app for service it's terrible 😡😡 …
No steak on steak nite for weeks why???,??
Miserable apart from one member of staff alison
Typical Wetherspoons but not one of their best. And of course no dogs allowed so only two stars

Day staff fantastic but the afternoon staff especially one male disrespectful when told him the client behind me was next totally negative and thought he owned the place I deal with who ever don’t tell me next. Not happy very negative around the bar also. Not a good professional image you want to portray get rid hindrances more than help can we place hand sanitizer outside the toilets I feel I’m the only person washing my hands with ts disgusting it’s wrong

I and my friends are regulars. Today one of my party ordered a Christmas meal and it was pathetic! The portion was very small,  no sprouts, no roast potatoes and the stuffing was rock hard! The whole meal was lukewarm, it was a complete  disappointment!. The person concerned was too embarrassed tk complain..
had jacket potato with beans & cheese , well lack of beans is the word .

Worst spoons in North Manchester by far. Full house even on a
rainy Wednesday afternoon etc... depressing place mainly frequented by the alcoholics of the local area that bang on the shutters of a morning so they can get their morning pint and cause trouble. Design is horrible and really really depressing.

In the current virus situation, why are misbehaving children allowed to run about the pub?. Can the manager not remind the parents to have them seated?. With limited space why allow children in at all?, and still tables are being secured like holiday sun loungers by the few ignorant punters. Very good bar staff, they have a tough job to do.

Had the lamb shank said it had veg with it there was 3 pieces of carrot and some soggy potatoe which I think should of been roast there was plenty of mash my hubby had pulled beef burger which was a burger with a large spoon of pulled beef on it he left it my granddaughter had veggie burger which was like a piece of cardboard you bit into it and all the saliva dried up in your mouth I think I am being over generous giving 2 stars

Main manager does not keep firm hand on under managers which in turn promotes a poor bar service some bar staff ignore waiting customers by talking to one another ,stocking shelves or walking out for a smoke. With C C cameras in operation it is  easy for there head office to monitor this 24hr a day . It is also substantially dirtier generally than any other whetherspoons  in the Manchester and surrounding areas
Basic pub not the best looking weatherspoons needs a revamp
Table was dirty and the food was like warm  not like other weatherspoons.
Why couldn't I get served, they only serve people they get a tip off , this as not happened once but several times
Food was good but they need to clean the tables more often table was very sticky
Waiting to long at the bar. Then serve someone who as just walked  in. Because they know what they are drinking. Toilets could do with looking at not all toilets have toilet paper.
Not very impressed  Tables dirty and  The chair was soaking wet through and it  Wasn't even me lol
Worn threadbare soft furnishings. The scruffiest in the country no doubt. Very busy and not enough staff
Worst Witherspoons in the country to many DHS laughing at the workets and needs a good revamp like an Atom bomb.
It's the worst weatherspoons I've ever visited it's full & drab would certainly benefit from a refurb
Never have enough toilet tissue toilets grubby some doors don't locks
Staff friendly service slow food poor quality.
Same people   ugly looking pub could do with a revamp staff good

Understaffed
long wait for food
dirty tables
I find it a pub w/out any ambience?
It's a Wetherspoons, so you always get fair prices and good food. It really doesn't have an atmosphere but there is no negative vibe.

We go regularly but on trying the food it was poor quality and badly prepared,  same food today in the regal moon Rochdale  great,must say the manager in the Harbour harbord is  working hard to keep a nice  place ,but the food is   not up to standard.

Food and drink ok, but when really busy staff struggling with clearing tables, even saw someone clearing their table and wiping over with a cloth so they had a clean table. When the waitress brought my food there were about10 glasses and 2 dirty plates on the table, she just dumped my food on the clear corner of the table and left me surrounded with clutter.
The wethies in my local town. The beer thereb is actually quite good and conditioned well. Always worth bobbing in for one if you're out in midd.
We go here on a regular basis,  food portions noticeably reduced and overcooked, couldn't get knife into parts of baked potato skin. Staff still working hard though, all  credit to them .
Mucky then there's the glasses too and don't order a bottle of Prosecco girls only three glasses in the place two covered in lippy

This wetherspoons is very handy for the bus stop that's why we visited it , the staff were very good  the food was fine the place was very busy for a Friday lunch time, but my one thing, I think it needs a spruce up it looks a little tired
Good prices like all spoon's. However cask ales are always "Available Soon' Needs a good spruce up,like most in GT Manchester. Table's a mess,and not enough staff. Apart from thàt fine.
Good drink, can't say the same for the food my burger was burn and the chips overcooked
Service ok. Customers always noisy and drunk and loud. Not a place for a quiet meal!
Ok but only parked while popping in shop nearby so looks busy but in car so no drinking as I spill it on roundabouts-kidding I never drink and drive will review if I get in the place!
Nice friendly staff.  Foods not the best but it's cheap. Standard Wetherspoons
Friendly staff. Reasonable food. Children welcome in day. Don't know what time they are no. Longer allowed.
It's ok, cheap food. If you want a quiet place then I wouldn't go. Cheap and cheerful
Food not as well cooked as in some, Whetherspoons. Very noisy environment. Quick & pleasant service.
Great staff food ok. Needs refurbishing and stop serving people who are clearly inebriated
Slow table service and the food wasn't great. Yes it's cheap but wasn't worth what we paid.
Ok Wetherspoons pub. Reasonable food and usually good beer but the real ale choice is limited for a Wetherspoons - too often half the pumps are 'coming soon'.
Food was fine, but a reduced menu for the breakfast.
Not the cleanest if places, food can be quit pure at times  more a place to start your night to have a few drinks and move on
Not bad service tables could be cleared for next customers sooner and quicker food is nice
Great staff, affordable food and good choice of drinks
Old man's pub, no music, food is quick n ping food (as I call it) ok for a cheap drink to start the night other then that forget it!
Good food,good beer,bit noisy and lively for me
Good choice of beers and nice food at good prices.
Not bad  but not brilliant either
Rough as. But food was ok

Busy. Bit grim in terms of Deco. Cheap booze & food!
It's a witherspoon, cheap and cheerful. Standard spoons decor
It's what you may expect of a wetherspoons. Cheap alcohol and food but a bit old and worn out.
Staff are good but needs a refurb
Great for a drink, food ok
Extensive range of products, very noisy
It's a Wetherspoon's in Middleton, not much else to say.
A little less than a typical Wetherspoons
Not the best but one of the cheapest
Was pretty quiet when I went
Smelled a bit funny but the food was very nice and at a shockingly amazing price, we had an issue with frozen bacon in hot pancakes but waiter sorted it pronto. Will definitely visit again

Step inside! The pub used to be a Burton's men store, at first it seemed very "working man's club".  Loud and lots of beer flowing. But I have to be fair, everyone seemed to be enjoying themselves and after a while it became quite comfortable. It's definitely a local pub for the area, No complaints, the food was good, the pub clean and the staff decent. If you like a Wetherspoons, it's more than OK!
Great beers and ciders at great prices, with an eclectic mix of people. The food is great too 🍻 …
Good all round pub and food
It's a spoons, it does what it says on the tin. Cheap, easy and reasonable quality.
A bit stricter since reopening but still a decent boozer to visit👍 …

What can you say good beer reasonably priced and the food is good too enjoyed a couple of breakfasts in there and coffee and tea is unlimited refills. My wife really likes the Eggs Benedict. She said "we've payed a lot more and had worse." So on the whole not bad at all.

My only concern is whenever i visit with my youngest Ben he always gets asked for ID. If he forgets his passport he is refused a drink.
There cannot be that many managers and he will be 21 in September.
But we always enjoy the food.
Really nice breakfast, very fast service. Pleasant staff

The food was good the service was good and staff were walking round cleaning all the time but they were asking the odd person if they had done track and trace but ppl just said yes when they hadn't so they need to look at that
Had a nice breakfast. Clean place, good staff. Can't fault it

The place is fine but breakfast was quite dry.
Hash browns especially and to a lesser extent blackpudding. Think it maybe wetherspoons generally rather than just here. Think will stick just to main meals here in future.
Good staff, pleasant place food good , drinks prices very good .
It does what it says on the tin! But if ordering steak, go on below what you would normally, e.g if you want medium, go medium-rare.
Nice staff at this pub but the place itself is looking a bit down.
Never had a bad meal in 2 years service fantastic 👏 …
Typical Spoons. Good value. Good beers.
It's a weatherspoons pub, good place to meet friends for a chat, wide range of beers, lagers, bottled beers, wines and spirits available, decent food served at reasonable prices
Lovely pleasant staff with a good atmosphere. The place itself needs to be bigger as its always packed
Usual wetherspoons pub nice and clean only difference was only paid 1'99 for the same beer I paid 2'40for in Manchester ,😬 …

Does what you expect a "Spoons" to do! (update: still the same... Although they have had a run of Pheonix brewery... Which was gorgeous!)

A nice spoons house, a bit too busy for me but covid rules were in place.

Decent food, good cheap beer and friendly staff.
Fast And Friendly Service, Food Was Piping Hot And Delicious, Would Highly Recommend... 😃 …
Typical Wetherspoon's really. Cheap beer, and decent food. The Mexican Monday food is awesome.

A proper local Weather spoons, all the expected ales and food but with a real feel of customers who live round the corner. Friendly bar staff, well run, clean tidy and welcoming.

10 of us went in last night at 7pm to celebrate Burn's Day only to be told that none of the special meals promoted for Burn's Week were available. No apologies were given. We were simply told in an offhand manner that we should have gone in earlier. Such a shame about the staff's couldn't care less attitude.
Excellent beer choice.  Drank Titanic  Nine tenths below 5.9 and Greene king heritage 5.  Ham egg  and chips brill.  Highly Recommended
Had a lovely fish, chips and mushy peas.  My wife had scampi.  Could not fault it. Staff  were fantastic.
Great breakfast, cheap as chips, nice and quiet. Definitely always my favourite place when I want a full English!
Excellent Steak! I Loved my Large Mixed Grill!! 🤩❤️👍 …
Really nice food & coffee served super quick.waitress was lovely as was the bar staff. Thanks we will be back

Food was lovely tonight well done to chef and front of house was outstanding thank u so much to the gentleman that accomadated all our needs and even gave us our money bk for the dessert we waited half an hour for and still got them would definitely go back again.
Great wetherspoons food always good here

The place is an absolute delight to frequent in! There's a lovely young chap of (I think) African origin named James who cannot do enough for his customers and in my opinion one day deserves to be the landlord!
Always a warm and friendly welcome staff are attentive and social and are more then happy to help food is great and there drinks are unique love coming here all the time for breakfasts keep it up
Improved a lot on service and with the food, still value for money on drinks and food have to say good on you guys.
Great friendly pub, staff really friendly
Good friendly atmosphere and good staff

It's a spoons, cheap and cheerful, with well priced guest ales.

Fantastic bar staff
Very nice Spoons pub. Nice central town location, clean tables and bar area. Friendly staff, and clean toilets.
Amazing breakfast, tasted fresh, value for money and decent portion size
If you want to see people drinking at 9am and a cheap breakfast it's the place to be

Much like any Wetherspoon's but staff very friendly and seating in some nice, cosy little nooks.
We'll worth a visit.
Staff are polite and love the gins they have my hubby had an efes beer he enjoyed his drink, the atmosphere was ok for the time of night was defo be going in again
Great service here today, particularly from Alison who was fab. Meals were really fast, even though it was very busy.
Quick friendly service. Relaxed atmosphere. Tasty vegan breakfast at a reasonable price.
Won the fruitys twice and walked out a happy person oh and great prices

Food was great, service was good, no problems, great price. Had a large breakfast and it was amazing for only £4.99.
Had a huge mixed grill,sirloin steak,lamb chop ,2 sausage, gammon,pork loin,mushrooms, tomato, egg and chips,onion rings and. peas plus a pint of Carling all for £11.50
A very very busy spoons. Visited whilst on a stop off on a long journey back south. Only popped in for a latte.
